definitions: Theodor Eicke was a German SS-Obergruppenführer who was the commandant of the Dachau concentration camp and later the commander of the SS Division Totenkopf of the Waffen-SS. He was one of the key figures in the establishment and administration of the Nazi concentration camp system.
examples: Theodor Eicke was a prominent figure in the SS.
The concentration camp system was heavily influenced by Theodor Eicke.
